main event: A civilian in Montebello, California reported seeing 6 unidentified flying objects moving slowly westward in December 1957.
interesting points: The witness initially reported seeing 6 objects, but later said there were 2 called in unison.
The objects were described as round, with orange lights, moving in unison.
The Air Force Public Relations office did not obtain a proper evaluation of the sighting due to an 'unintelligent person being used' and the haste to close the case.
The Los Angeles Office of Information said the filming was probably the best UFO report they had received, but concluded the case negatively.
The Air Force analyst stated the data was considered insufficient for evaluation, and the case was left as 'Unknown'.
